name: Thor: Ragnarok Multiple Choice Quiz | 10 Questions

questions.text: Who was replaced as keeper of the Bifrost Bridge?
questions.explanation:
Heimdall.

	Heimdall, played by Idris Elba, was the gatekeeper of the bridge in all of the other Marvel Cinematic Universe movies in which it appeared. He was replaced by Skurge (played by Karl Urban).  Early in the movie Thor (Chris Hemsworth) was screaming for Heimdall to open the bridge, not knowing he had been replaced.

Loki.

	Loki, using his powers to transform himself, impersonated his adoptive father. Meanwhile Odin was hidden away on Earth where he couldn't retake the throne. The end of Odin's life was quickly approaching, which would signal the start of Ragnarok by releasing an evil being he had imprisoned.

questions.text: How was Hela related to Thor?
questions.explanation:
Sister.

	Hela, the former leader of Asgard's armies, was Odin's first born. When she became evil Odin imprisoned her and wiped away all traces she ever existed. Thor and Loki, neither one, even knew she existed until just before Odin's death. Hela was played by Cate Blanchett.

questions.text: Which other member of the Avenger's did Thor have to fight?
questions.explanation:
Hulk.

	Among the options, only Hulk/Bruce Banner, were in this movie. Hulk was played by Mark Ruffalo. Both heroes were exiled to a distant planet where they were forced to fight each other. During a conversation Thor actually referred to Hulk as one of the Avengers. Eventually they escaped together.

questions.text: Matt Damon made a cameo appearance as an actor in a play. Who did he portray in the play?
questions.explanation:
Loki.

	When Thor returned to Asgard he stumbled upon a play being put on by Odin (Who was actually Loki in disguise). The actors played Thor (Luke Hemsworth, the brother of the actual actor playing Thor), Loki (Matt Damon, a friend of Tom Hiddleston, the actual actor playing Loki) and Odin (Sam Neill). Damon also played a character named Loki in "Dogma", though the two characters have nothing in common.

questions.text: Who helped Thor to locate his missing father?
questions.explanation:
Dr. Strange

	Shortly after finding out that Jane Foster and Thor had broken up, Dr. Strange left Thor a card to help him locate the Sanctum Sanctorum. Once in Strange's layer, Stephen helped Thor to locate Odin. It was the first time they'd met up on screen chronologically, though a short scene had been used as an after credits sequence in another Marvel Cinematic Universe movie.

questions.text: Who took Thor and turned him over to the Grandmaster to be forced into becoming a fighter?
questions.explanation:
Valkyrie.

	Played by Tessa Thompson, it was Valkyrie's first appearance in the Marvel Cinematic Universe. While on Sakaar, she was known as Scrapper 142. She was also an Asgardian, having been outcast when Hela had destroyed the rest of the Valkyries.

questions.text: Loki was also exiled to Sakaar with Thor.
questions.explanation:
True.

	Both of them were knocked off the Bifrost transport on the way back to Asgard. Loki was knocked out of the stream a few seconds early, and arrived on the planet weeks before his adopted brother. While Thor was turned into a fighter, Loki befriended the Grandmaster and became one of the elite. It was while on Sakaar that Thor had his hair cut off. The barber was played by Stan Lee, who helped to created the character for Marvel Comics.

questions.text: Who was the fighter trying to start a revolution on Sakaar?
questions.explanation:
Korg.

	Korg, who was an alien made of rock, was imprisoned because he had tried to start a revolution and didn't print up enough flyers. He told that reason to Thor early on. As Thor, Hulk, Loki and Valkyrie were trying to escape the planet, they armed Korg and helped him start another revolution. Korg was played by Taika Waititi, who also directed the movie.

questions.text: What object did Thor disguise his hammer as, while on Earth early in the movie?
questions.explanation:
Umbrella.

	While on Earth he carried the umbrella instead of walking around with Mjolnar. The hammer was later destroyed in the movie. Why he decided to disguise the hammer was unknown though, as he didn't hide his identity, even stopping to take pictures with people who recognized him in New York.
